messages.text:
How do I build binaries of packages without a configure file?

I am building binary for Trilinos. It has multiple packages and (for simplicity's sake) YES packages have configure files and NEY packages don't. So when I finish the cmake (of all), configure (of YESs), make and install, binaries are generated only for YES packages. So it turns out NEY packages won't build with this resulting build_tarball:sweat_smile: So now I have a completed build_tarball
 which only builds half the packages required

attachments.title: Announcing ygg
attachments.text: ygg ygg is a simple installer for using BinaryBuilder.jl built binaries from Yggdrasil outside of Julia. Installing ygg is simple (see the README), and then installing binaries is even simpler. Here is an example of adding the fzf fuzzy finder: $ ygg install fzf The list of binaries that is currently available (see README) is just the ones I have used myself. Adding new ones is, generally, as simple as adding a line in the Makefile as in this commit. Feel free to add your favorite program to t...

messages.text:
does anyone actually use julia in CentOS 6?  I'm trying to install Yggdrasil ccache in the docker image of CentOS 6, but
```[root@a0dc056fc7db /]# ccache 
ccache: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.18' not found (required by ccache)
ccache: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `CXXABI_1.3.5' not found (required by ccache)
ccache: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.14' not found (required by ccache)
ccache: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.17' not found (required by ccache)
ccache: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.15' not found (required by ccache)```
it comes with libstdc++ corresponding to gcc 4.4.7, which is even much older than our oldest version of GCC
